qas.question: Where was the differential analyzer built by H.L. Hazen?
The differential analyzer by H.L. Hazen and Vannevar Bush was first being built in what year?
The torque amplifiers of the differential analyzer were created by whom?

context: The art of mechanical analog computing reached its zenith with the differential analyzer, built by H. L. Hazen and Vannevar Bush at <a0_0>MIT<a0_0/> starting in <a1_0>1927<a1_0/>. This built on the mechanical integrators of James Thomson and the torque amplifiers invented by <a2_0>H. W. Nieman<a2_0/>. A dozen of these devices were built before their obsolescence became obvious.
